update.description:
This is the first PR of the brew bottle creation integrated into the release.py and implementing the following workflow:

```
 - release.py
 -> update tarball hash in formula (generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater) [not in this PR, already implemented]
    -> build bottle (generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder)
          -> upload bottle to S3 (repository_uploader) 
          -> update bottle hash in formula (generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater)
```
Testing runs:

 * [Bottle builder](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/37/)
 * [Bottle hash update](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/25/)

It currently creates two different pull requests to update hashes. @scpeters mentioned that we will need to commit the second modification in the first pull request open. I've leave this for a next pull request, I still need to figure out how to hack this.

content.raw:
If my memory still works fine, that is the proposal of the step `          -> update bottle hash in formula (generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater)` in this same pull request. The previous gazebo8 testing job did not trigger it since the job was disabled (probably I run core.dsl for testing workflow and that disable that job). Your point was to update an existing pull request and this PR will create a new pull request, making the CI mechanism to fail.

I would go for a different PR to implement the change to handle all in the same PR so we can advance: test this code in real scenarios and don't mess with branches in DSL.
content.html:
If my memory still works fine, that is the proposal of the step -> update bottle hash in formula (generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater) in this same pull request. The previous gazebo8 testing job did not trigger it since the job was disabled (probably I run core.dsl for testing workflow and that disable that job). Your point was to update an existing pull request and this PR will create a new pull request, making the CI mechanism to fail.

I would go for a different PR to implement the change to handle all in the same PR so we can advance: test this code in real scenarios and don't mess with branches in DSL.

pullrequest.title: Brew bottles creation and hash updating

content.raw:
I've updated the tests in the `ignition-math2`, `sdformat3`, and `gazebo6` formulae so that they will fail if there are any linking errors. Currently the `sdformat3` and `gazebo6` bottles are broken due to a newer version of boost in the master branch. I [asked a question on the homebrew issue tracker](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew/issues/47517#issuecomment-167955595), and I think that they re-trigger broken bottle builds by hand. We could add some additional homebrew testing jobs that would check specific formulae, for example:

~~~
brew test-bot --tap=osrf/simulation --ci-testing ignition-math2
~~~

This runs many commands, including testing all downstream formulae, and it detects failures in sdformat3 and gazebo6. We should be able to run this once a night to verify that formula installation is working. Then if we detect a problem, we could bump the bottle revision number and it would build a new bottle automatically?
content.html:
I've updated the tests in the ignition-math2, sdformat3, and gazebo6 formulae so that they will fail if there are any linking errors. Currently the sdformat3 and gazebo6 bottles are broken due to a newer version of boost in the master branch. I asked a question on the homebrew issue tracker, and I think that they re-trigger broken bottle builds by hand. We could add some additional homebrew testing jobs that would check specific formulae, for example:

brew test-bot --tap=osrf/simulation --ci-testing ignition-math2

This runs many commands, including testing all downstream formulae, and it detects failures in sdformat3 and gazebo6. We should be able to run this once a night to verify that formula installation is working. Then if we detect a problem, we could bump the bottle revision number and it would build a new bottle automatically?

content.raw: also, `--bottle` and `--verbose` are implied by `--ci-pr` so they can be dropped (mentioned [here](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew/issues/47517#issuecomment-167955595) by Mike McQuaid)
content.html: also, --bottle and --verbose are implied by --ci-pr so they can be dropped (mentioned here by Mike McQuaid)

content.raw: I changed the test recently to call `gz sdf`, which prints a help string. It doesn't need GPU, but it at least verifies that libraries are resolved. So I think we can remove the `|| true`
content.html: I changed the test recently to call gz sdf, which prints a help string. It doesn't need GPU, but it at least verifies that libraries are resolved. So I think we can remove the || true

content.raw:
To append the bottle hash to the existing pull request, we just need to push to the same branch as the pull request. We can find this out by using the github API and parsing some json:

* https://api.github.com/repos/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pulls/62
content.html:
To append the bottle hash to the existing pull request, we just need to push to the same branch as the pull request. We can find this out by using the github API and parsing some json:

  • https://api.github.com/repos/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pulls/62
